text: not in their worst nightmares did anyone
in Brazil think this is how it would end
the scene had been set at the stadium in
Belo Horizonte and at street parties
across the country this was to have been
Brazil's inevitable march towards their
own World Cup final but everywhere heads
dropped mouths open wide and people
cried as this proud footballing country
was completely humiliated the stadium
emptied and the fan fest fell quiet no
one in Brazil had seen this coming I
think it's really sad in the end to end
the competition to end the championship
with this kind of negative result for
Brazil for the Brazilian people no it's
very embarrassing you know the Germans
have well and truly rained on Brazil's
parade tonight this has been a complete
footballing humiliation any notion that
Brazil were finally going to win a World
Cup on their own soil has been
completely extinguished this has been a
roller coaster of a tournament with
ultimately disappointment and
embarrassment in a country where
football means so much for the duration
of Brazil's progress in the World Cup
the country had appeared relatively calm
and stable everyone's eyes on the
football the danger now is that some of
the divisions protests and arguments we
saw in the run-up to the tournament
could return plunge in Brazil back into
crisis Witter Davis BBC News Rio de
Janeiro
